channel.title: Gren news
channel.description: News from the Gren core team

item.title: Gren-in-Gren, and other developments
item.description: The first few lines of a new Gren compiler is being written this week. The goal is to better support upcomming features of the language, as well as being

item.title: Gren 0.3.0: Source maps
item.description: JavaScript developers have always had access to a powerful debugger for finding bugs in their applications. Since Gren compiles to JavaScript, it's also possible to use the same tool for debugging Gren applications. The experience isn't great, however, as you're forced to debug the JavaScript that the compiler spits out instead of the actual code you wrote.

item.title: Gren 0.2.1: Testing, testing
item.description: The original plan was to not do another release until Gren 0.3 this summer but, while this is still the goal, we've implemented enough functionality to warrant a new release today. The theme for Gren 0.3 is "Testing and Debugging", and Gren 0.2.1 delivers on the first half of this theme.

item.title: Gren 0.2: Hello, NodeJS
item.description: Six months after the release of 0.1, a new release is here with a bunch of exciting features. This includes a built-in code formatter and basic support for creating applications that run on NodeJS.

item.title: Documentation as a first class citizen
item.description: A crucial aspect of any programming language, is how easy it is to discover and learn new functionality.

item.title: Gren 0.1.0 is released
item.description: Today marks the first release of Gren, a programming language that helps you write simple and correct software.
